intro: Hieracium remotum, commonly known as the distant hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Hieracium remotum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
